server.flask_server module¶

Flask server, a webserver with python as backend.

server.flask_server.call_pipeline()¶

This method calls the pipeline. The input is provided by a ‘POST’ method in the server call. The post-data should be a dict of the following structure: {“input_string”: “…”[, “steps”: “…”]}, where the “input_string” is either a plain string (if post-correction is the first step) or a json-formated string for the other steps, and the “steps” denote which steps to execute in order, from the possibilities [“post_correction”, “ner_bert”, “ner_lists”, “modernisation”]. If the optional “steps” key is not provided, ALL steps are executed in this order. If an empty list is provided, an error is raised.’’ :return: {“results”: result containing the augmented data, “message”: “Success”}. See the schema for details on the form of the result.

server.flask_server.handle_bad_request(error)¶

Handle bad requests.

server.flask_server.handle_internal_server_error(error)¶

Handle internal errors.

server.flask_server.main()¶

Fallback to point users in the right direction if they do not specify the correct application to call
